`ncvreg` fits models that fall into the penalized likelihood framework.  Rather than estimating $\bb$ by maximizing the likelihood, in this framework we estimate $\bb$ by minimizing the objective function

$$
Q(\bb|\X, \y) = L(\bb|\X,\y) + P_\lam(\bb),
$$

where $L(\bb|\X,\y)$ is the loss (typically, the negative log-likelihood) and $P_\lam(\bb)$ is the penalty.  This article describes the different penalties available in `ncvreg`; see [models](models.html) for more information on the different loss functions available.
